name: nero
text: The first four panels could be a standalone comic and I would still laugh a good chunk of my hindquarters off..

name: locuscosecant
text: That's what makes Achewood great; it doesn't stop having panels just because there was a punchline.

name: saint
text: and it won't stop until your hindquarters vanish.

name: catachresis
text: Mad love for the pretentious restaurant sign. It is so true.

name: hollis
text: I wonder if it is a mockery of "Pasta?"

name: riazm
text:
There's a shop near me which is named

"Parties; Made Simple"

name: drago25
text: That is some mad punctuation mishap

name: clintisiceman
text: Not that it is really the same thing, but I live by a party store called "I've Just Had a  MARVELOUS PARTY!" or something along those lines. It is basically the worst thing to name an establishment ever.

name: tekende
text:
You must promise me something now.

If that store should ever close down, please, please make a big sign that says "Sorry for partying" and tape it to their window or door. And then take a picture of it. This would make me very happy.

name: belgand
text:
While it's a fairly massive chain and in no means pretentious I still love how Quickly is one of the very few shops to have an adverb for a name.

If it's just due to being a translation error or such that they never bothered to do anything about I will take it back a little bit.

name: mashisoyo
text: I've seen "House of Batman", a clothing store, "Cock", a restaurant, "Bongbong", a clothing store, and "Hunt Kids", also a clothing store. I live in Korea though.

name: overmedicated
text: Spotted in Kowloon; Superpower Electricity. The Chinese, man.

name: mashisoyo
text: Also in China - "Grotesque Photographers", "Palatable Pizza" and, right in the middle of Wangfujing St in Beijing, a huge banner announcing an exhibition of "Legendary Luminous Balls".

name: darqhermit
text: I too live in Korea. I've seen "Hunt Kids" in Suwon. There's also "Boobie Boobie" in Hongdae and many many more that it's way to early in the morning to remember right now.

name: shutup_shutup
text: I can't stop laughing at how funny that name is.  Who the hell names their store an entire sentence?

name: prettyrad
text: I saw "Yes, orange", but it was closed. I'm still not entirely sure what the establishment was for.

name: tekende
text:
Oranges?

No, no. Too obvious. Think, tekende, think!

name: mangtastic
text: I like to think it was a furniture outlet that only sold pieces that were a shade of orange.  I also like to imagine that it was closed when prettyrad saw it because there is no way they could keep a business like that from going under.

name: libelandslander
text: Someone lamed you? They must really like orange furniture. Or maybe... you have destroyed their dream.

name: killingthejay
text: It is.  They are all over the place.  I kinda wish Nice Pete would do his drive-through stunt on them.

name: echidnaboy
text: Here are some of their colons

name: atticusonline
text: You know that p o u l t r y ; does not sell any kind of chicken in any form or fashion.

name: alzuna
text: There's something about a restaurant's (or any business actually) name in all lowercase letters...It just has this vibe...

name: allanpinkerton
text: Instant five just for "p o u l t r y ;"

name: whuppins
text: I love Ray apologizing to a stranger about how his colleague is a "terrible man". I'd like to be able to use that line some day.

name: estutius
text: I have used that line before. You really don't want to be in a situation where you have to use it.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Maybe the leech line twigged it initially, but Ray yelling into a phone about child trafficking and pausing to inform his fellow patrons that his "colleague is a terrible man" is pretty hunter thompson.

name: stormagnet
text: ...I thought he was referring to leeches. You've just made this comic far more disturbing for me.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Ray has faith in the essential decency of the white man's culture.  Todd can't decide whether he should shit on that decency or cut some lines out of it.

name: professorhazard
text:
The guy is actually peeved because Ray is only wearing a thong .

And sunglasses and a medallion.

name: sandswipe
text: Damn, I don't even notice anymore. That is pretty terrifying when you think about it, on several levels.

name: soticoto
text: I'd so just punch that stranger for looking at me.

name: heccibiggs
text: If you get curious about who lamed this comment, don't bother with the setting-your-lame-threshold-to-one thing. It was me. I lamed you, because your comment was incredibly lame.

name: rowboat
text: Thankfully he's long gone.

name: heccibiggs
text: True dat.

name: soticoto
text:
I love it when proving someone wrong is this easy.

p.s. I'm not generally the sort of person who lowers the lame-threshold to see who lamed me, as that would imply it mattered, or indeed that I could do anything about it.

name: greenkoolayd
text: ouch.  that almost hurt MY feelings......

name: dougthehead
text: Man, Todd had better break the hell back in that place.   Ray sounded serious.

name: underpantstime
text: p o u l t r y ; is really fucking hilarious. onstad would fucking slay at Balderdash.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray is so angry at Todd for breaking out of rehab. That is a really terrible thing to do.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
"He said Get back in Rehab"
I said "N-n-no, n-n-no, n-n-No!"

name: tinhand
text: "Candle at both ends." is a classy phrase. I somehow doubt that Todd actually make him a fortune on Wall-Street the previous year

name: straw
text:
My candle burns at both ends
It will not last the night.
But, ah, my foes and, oh, my friends,
It gives a lovely light.

name: honesttom
text: Yes Rabbie Burns!

name: toddtoddtodd
text: No, him!  Yes, Edna St. Vincent Millay!

name: soticoto
text: My shitandle burns at both ends so I don't forget about it.

name: tellumo
text: Man, I hate on some Edna St. Vincent Millay. That poet is a crap-face repeater .

name: professorhazard
text: A candle burning at both ends , you say...?

name: nutmeg
text: You get back in rehab and you get a leech on you!

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, entropyends, Overmedicated, Mangtastic, pitseleh, echidnaboy, Darthemed)

name: lolsworth
text: p o u l t r y ;

name: nice_enuf_guy
text: Mr. Smuckles, that looks like an awfully bold vintage in your glass for such light dinner fare. Perhaps you should try your neighbor's choice.

name: mastronaut
text:
But you shouldn't be afraid to match red wines with white meat, as long as the meat has a full enough flavor to hang with the wine.

It's in this month's Playboy Advisor.

name: pantscomeoff
text: To my mind, the most interesting thing here is that there is a place you can call to order crack for delivery.

name: odei
text: I imagine that place would be a crack dealer's phone.

name: deovalente
text: I enjoy how Ray must specify that Todd is calling him on the telephone .

name: pberard
text: They have shirts saying "Jesus is my Homie". How about shirts saying "Todd is my Colleague"?

name: bjorntd
text: Underneath it, in a smaller font (He is a Terrible Man)

name: tekende
text: I understand, Ray. My colleague is a terrible man as well.

name: tekende
text: I don't know what I was going for with this comment.

name: swatson
text:
I once got a late night phone call from a little friend of mine who had just broken out of rehab.

Last week she pawned my ipod. :(

In her defence, her parents had named her "Nirvana".

name: ragnarok_engine
text:
Sadly, I keep reading that as PWNED your iPod.

I am a terrible man.

name: johnnybaverage
text: Chubbied because I keep doing the same damn thing.

name: direhaggis
text: Ray is insistent that the squirrel break back into the rehab clinic and put more leeches on himself.

name: tasteful
text: the funniest thing though is "I'm sorry. My colleague is a terrible man."

name: tonyhighwind
text: If this were a Fuck You Friday, Ray would be throwing wine in that dude's face without even looking at him.

name: psquid
text: It saddens me that Ray is not wearing his angry-phone-talking jacket. Though this is probably due to not expecting a call.
